document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Rodrigo B. & Melo, Gabriel A. R.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the bee genus Thectochlora Moure (Hymenoptera, Apidae, Halictinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the bee genus Thectochlora Moure (Hymenoptera, Apidae, Halictinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Augochloropsis ( Pseudaugochloropsis ) basiatra
Strand, 1910
: 490
. Lectotype male (presently designated), Paraguay : Villa Morra ( ZMHB , examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species was placed in
Pseudaugochlora
by
Moure & Hurd ( 1987 )
without examining the type material. More recently, Moure (pers. comm.) was able to study the type series and associated the species with
Thectochlora
.

Similarly to
T. alaris
, females of
T. basiatra
also show conspicuous variation in body size; for example, the maximum head width of specimens from Vila Velha, Paraná, varies from 1.78 to 2.02 mm . As mentioned under
T . alaris
, the females of these two species could not be distinguished on external features. Therefore, a diagnosis is presented only for males.

Based on male features,
T. basiatra
groups with
T . hamata
sp. nov.
and
T . mixta
sp. nov.
The male antennae in these three species has a small glabrous area in the middle of each flagellomere (character 04- 1 in the cladistic analysis). This kind of pubescence pattern is found in other halictine bees; as an example,
McGinley ( 1986 )
has named these areas as oval tyli in
Lasioglossum
( Halictini ). In the phylogenetic analysis,
T. basiatra
came out as sister-group of
T. hamata
due to the non-produced posterior border of the male S 4 (character 13 ,
Figs. 16 and 18
).

Antennal flagellomeres II to XI subequal in length, short pubescence restricted to basal and apical one-third of the flagellomeres, leaving small glabrous areas in the middle of each flagellomere; face wider than long; fore leg trochanter without dorsal hook; S 4 disc with sparse and short pubescence, medially with a tuft of very short setae.

Paralectotype female.
Measurements. Eye: 1.18 ; cl: 0.43 ; c-a: 0.81 ; c-o: 0.98 ; mhl: 1.68 ; c-e: 0.2 ; mhw: 1.79 ; mml: 0.08 ; abl: 1.79 . ( 1 ) Head. Wider than long. Supraclypeal area only weakly convex, its lateral portions with same curvature as adjacent paraocular surface; lower paraocular area with many decumbent and few erect hairs, the latter with very short branches, malar space short. ( 2 ) Mesoscutum. Outline, in dorsal view, of lateral half of projecting anterior border rounded. ( 3 ) Mesepisternum. Almost entirely covered with irregular punctures, not very rugulose. ( 4 ) Metapostnotum. Basal sulcus with few complete transverse carinae. ( 5 ) Propodeum. Entirely covered with fine punctation and with short plumose hairs. ( 6 ) Legs. Fore leg trochanter without dorsal hook; hook of mid leg trochanter short, about one-half trochanter width. ( 7 ) Metasoma. Punctures on marginal zone of T 2 about 2–3 puncture diameters apart, denser on disc (about one puncture diameter apart). ( 8 ) Body color. Metallic green with brown legs.

The type series of
Augochloropis basiatra
deposited at ZMHB is composed of one male and two females. The male specimen, bearing the following labels “Asuncion,\ Paraguay \ Vila Morra\
9 .XI.05
\ J. D. ANISITS” “Augochlor\ opsis ba-\ siatra n\ Strand det.” “ Type ” “Zool. Mus.\ Berlin” “ Thectochlora \ alaris [male simbol]\ (
Vachal, 1904
)\ Pe. J. S. Moure 1996 ” is here designated lectotype in order to stabilize the taxonomy of the group. The following label was added: “ LECTOTYPE \
Augochloropsis
\
( Pseudaugochloropsis ) basiatra
\
Strand, 1910
\ desig. Gonçalves & Melo, 2006 ”. Paralectotypes :
1 female
( ZMHB ), “Asuncion,\ Paraguay \ Vila Morra\
30 .XI.04
\ J. D. ANISITS” “Augochlor\ opsis ba-\ siatra n\ Strand det.” “ Type ” “Zool. Mus.\ Berlin”;
1 female
with same data except “
19 .XI.05
” and without any type label. The integument color of the lectotype is somewhat faded; it also lacks the left antenna beyond the 1 st flagellomere.
